There are also well maintained communal gardens and grounds which surround the property resident and visitor parking on site. The apartment is approached via a lift or stairs and is located within easy access of the communal landing on the second floor. The property is accessed via an entrance lobby which has doors to all rooms and a useful storage cupboard which houses the high pressure hot water system. There is also a secure entry phone system linked to the front door. The lounge has French doors and a Juliet balcony which faces in a southerly direction and has views over the communal gardens. There is an electric living flame effect gas fire with surround and hearth. A door leads through into the kitchen which has a range of wall and base cupboards in a light ash effect. There is a laminate worktop over and an inset stainless steel sink with mixer tap and draining board. Integrated appliances include an AEG fitted eye level oven, separate AEG electric hob with extractor over and under counter fridge and freezer. There is a window which over looks the communal gardens. The double bedroom has mirrored fitted wardrobes with hanging space and storage over and a window. The shower room has the benefit of a large walk in shower, wash hand basin which is set into a vanity unit and a WC. There are partially tiled walls and heated towel rail and an extractor fan Tenure & Possession Leasehold. The lease commenced on the 1st March 2005 and runs of 125 years. displayAddress: 50, South Cleatlam, Darlington, County Durham, DL2 3QP
detailedDescription: The Property 50 South Cleatlam is a deceptively spacious end terraced property, positioned in the peaceful hamlet on the outskirts of Staindrop. To the rear, there is a dining area which in turn leads to the kitchen. Fitted with a range of base and wall mounted storage units, topped with contrasting worktops which incorporate a stainless steel sink. Integral appliances include an electric four ring hob, an electric oven, and a fridge/freezer. Stairs from the reception vestibule rise to the first floor landing. The master bedroom is a well proportioned double facing the front, while the second is an additional double to the rear. The family bathroom is fitted with a white suite comprising a WC, a wash hand basin and a panel enclosed bath with a shower over. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold Limited. This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyer’s solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance. The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee This being 4.5% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,600.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded. Referral Arrangements The Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will be of benefit; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted. displayAddress: Stone Roof Barn, Newton Underwood, Morpeth, Northumberland, NE61 3QP
detailedDescription: Set within the beautiful Northumberland countryside near Mitford, this exceptional fourbedroom detached barn conversion offers a rare blend of rustic charm and contemporary comfort. Thoughtfully designed and finished to a high standard, the property provides generous living space in a truly idyllic rural setting. The home features four wellproportioned bedrooms, alongside a characterful living room complete with a cosy stove — perfect for relaxing evenings. The elegant dining room and the fitted kitchen, equipped with quality builtin appliances, create an inviting space for both everyday living and entertaining. Signature Northumberland arches frame the living and dining areas, adding architectural interest while drawing the eye to the sweeping countryside views beyond. Ideally located, the property sits just moments from the historic market town of Morpeth and offers excellent access to the A1, making Newcastle city centre reachable in around 30 minutes. This balance of tranquillity and convenience makes the home particularly appealing. Further benefits include double glazing and oil central heating, ensuring yearround comfort. With its desirable location and distinctive character, early viewing is strongly recommended. displayAddress: 5a, St Thomas Crescent, City Centre, Newcastle Upon Tyne, NE1 4LG
detailedDescription: This exceptional two bedroom upper floor maisonette offers a rare blend of luxury, character, and modern comfort. Finished to an impeccable standard throughout, it comes fully furnished with premium touches including a Bang & Olufsen home entertainment system and a Quooker instant hot water tap. The beautifully designed kitchen is ideal for entertaining, while the magnificent living room showcases triple Georgian shuttered windows, elegant period cornicing, and a grand feature fireplace. Set on the historic and highly sought-after St. Thomas’ Crescent, this Grade II listed property dates back to around 1862 and embodies timeless city living. The gentle curve of the crescent creates a sense of privacy and enclosure, yet Newcastle’s vibrant shops, restaurants, and nightlife are just moments away. The layout includes an entrance hall leading into the home, an inner hallway with access to the garden, and stairs rising to the first floor. The spacious kitchen is fitted to an exceptional standard, featuring sleek two-tone cabinetry, a composite worktop with concealed integrated appliances, a dishwasher, a breakfast bar, and a bespoke banquette seating area. The impressive living room is a true showpiece, with its three Georgian shuttered windows, ornate cornicing, and striking fireplace. Upstairs on the second floor are two generous double bedrooms and a beautifully appointed luxury wet room. This is a truly distinctive home that must be viewed to fully appreciate the craftsmanship, character, and quality on offer. detailedDescription: Due to end of tenancy, the Land on Barnsley Road, Scawsby is available to let on a 2-year Farm Business Tenancy rolling 3-month to 3-months thereafter and commencing on Wednesday 1st October 2025. The Property extends to approximately 262.22 acres (106.12 hectares) of predominately productive Grade 2 arable land and includes a modern agricultural building. Situation The Land on Barnsley Road lies approximately 1 mile west of Scawsby, a suburb of Doncaster located approximately 2 miles north-west of the city centre. Scawsby provides a range of local amenities including primary and secondary schooling as well as a community centre, health centre and 2 public houses. The Property The Property comprises 262.22 acres (106.12 hectares) or thereabouts of predominately productive Grade 2 arable land alongside a modern agricultural building. The Land is presented within 3 land parcels, intersect by Scawsby Lane, Barnsley Road and Sheep Walk Lane. All parcels benefit from roadside access. The modern farm building is situated on the eastern side of Scawsby Lane. The Property is offered on a 2-year Farm Business Tenancy rolling 3-month to 3-months thereafter and commencing in October 2025. The current owners are looking to ensure that the Property is managed in a sound, productive manner. Land In total, the Land extends to 262.22 acres (106.12 hectares) or thereabouts of predominately productive Grade 2 arable land. The Land is relatively flat in elevation and has been used to date within a standard arable rotation of wheat, barley, beans. Farm Building Included within the tenancy agreement is a modern, steel portal framed, farm building with a concrete floor measuring approximately 260sqm (2,799sqft). The building benefits from a phase 3 electricity supply as well as a mains water connection. Environmental Stewardship There are no existing Environmental or Countryside Stewardship schemes across the land. However, the Landlord would encourage the incoming Tenant to consider entering into an agri-environment scheme subject to Landlord’s consent. Conditions of Tender Persons intending to make an offer are advised to inspect the Property thoroughly and take all factors into account before submitting their application. The Tenant will be required to make a contribution of £500 plus VAT towards the cost of preparing the Farm Business Tenancy agreement. A record of condition will be prepared at the commencement of the tenancy with the associated cost to be shared between the Landlord and Tenant. The record will be produced by the Landlord’s Agent. The Tenancy Agreement Term: 2 Year Term - entry from Wednesday 1st October 2025, until Thursday 30th September 2027, rolling 3month—3months thereafter. displayAddress: Aycliffe Quarry, Newton Aycliffe, County Durham, DL5 6NB
detailedDescription: The Opportunity Expressions of interest are invited for the freehold interest in the land edged red on the plan. The site amounts to approximately 37acres (15 hectares) and consideration will be given to a sale or joint venture over the whole or part of the land. There is an extant planning consent for commercial development on the southern part of the site. The Vendor is in the process of submitting an outline planning application for the provision of a mix of leisure and employment uses including B1, B2 and B8 across the whole site. Location Newton Aycliffe is a New Town in County Durham which was founded in 1947. It has a population of approximately 26,633. The town centre has undergone a multi-million pound redevelopment over recent years and Aycliffe Business Park to the south and west of the site is the second largest industrial estate in the North East region. The property is situated to the south of Aycliffe Village, to the east of Aycliffe Business Park and directly north of the proposed Forest Park major commercial development. Description The site extends to approximately 37ac (15ha) which is available in whole or part. The land comprises the former mineral extraction and landfill site at Aycliffe Quarry. It includes a mix of agricultural land, woodland and an area of hardstanding. Access The site benefits from excellent road communications and holds a prominent position just off the A167 and A1. Planning History In 2015, planning permission was granted for the erection of an industrial unit and change of use of land to general storage and commercial market. Further information can be found in County Durham planning register, application DM/15/03610/FPA. Outline planning permission was granted in 2000 for a hotel/motel conference centre with leisure and recreation facilities under planning reference 7/1999/0193/DM, with a subsequent reserved matter application granted permission in 2003. Tenure & Possession The freehold interest in the property is offered for sale by private treaty, as a whole, with a guide price of £3,000,000. The property shall be exchanged with vacant possession upon completion. Costs Each party will be responsible for their own costs incurred. The Area The site is located in the semi-rural village of Crawcrook, Ryton which has a good selection of amenities including a library, Co-op, two petrol stations and a host of independent retailers. Crawcrook has strong transport links with regular bus services and is located under 5 miles from the A1 for Northern and Southern travel. Also situated under 2 miles away are the popular Hadrian’s and Keelman’s ways, that provide traffic free cycle routes into Newcastle and Gateshead. Planning The building is currently vacant but was previously occupied as a furniture restoration business, which would fall within Use Class E. It is considered that the Site could be suitable for a flexible commercial use such as a gym, nursery or fitness studio. displayAddress: 30A, Redwell Court, Harmire Enterprise Park,, Barnard Castle, County Durham, DL12 8BN
detailedDescription: DESCRIPTION The subject property comprises a modern, single-storey industrial unit of steel portal frame construction, forming part of a well-maintained terraced block within the established Harmire Enterprise Park. The property benefits from an open shared yard to the front, providing access and parking, as well as good circulation space for deliveries and staff. Access to the unit is available via a full-height roller shutter loading door and a separate pedestrian entrance leading directly into a welcoming reception area. Internally, the accommodation has been fitted out to a high standard to suit its current use as a gym and fitness studio, offering flexibility for a range of alternative commercial or light industrial uses (subject to the necessary consents). The total internal area extends to approximately 1,855.55 sq.ft (172.42 sq.m) at ground floor level and is arranged to provide: A reception and waiting area Main open-plan gym/studio space Toilet and shower facilities A kitchenette/staff area An additional studio or training space to the rear of the unit The unit is well-lit with a combination of natural light and suspended lighting, and benefits from modern finishes throughout, including vinyl flooring, painted walls, and ceiling-mounted heating and cooling units (not tested). While the property is currently fitted for leisure use, it can be reverted to a standard industrial specification with minimal work, depending on occupier requirements. The town forms part of the Redcar and Cleveland borough and has a population of approximately 6,000 (2011). Saltburn is situated on the northern edge of the North Yorks Moors National Park. The A174 to the south of the town links to Middlesbrough to the west and along the coast to Whitby to the south east. The nearest motorway is the A1(M), approximately 32 miles to the east, which provides access to Newcastle to the north and Leeds to the south. Saltburn railway station oers regular services to Middlesbrough, Darlington and Bishop Auckland The Station Building hosts weekly and monthly markets and the annual Saltburn Food Festival which attracts over 20,000 people is centred on the Station Building. displayAddress: Walker Park, Newcastle Upon Tyne, Tyne and Wear, NE6 3HR
detailedDescription: Properties Newcastle City Council have a portfolio of property located within the city's 33 parks, offering tenantable buildings in varying size and specification. The unique aesthetic of these properties combines with the health and wellbeing impact of spending time in a green space environment, providing your organisation with a great USP. The properties all offer high versatility and so may lend themselves to a wide range of uses, subject to obtaining the requisite consents where necessary. These particulars set out the specific premises and units that are available for tenanted occupation at any given time. However, the schedule of the specific premises which are available will vary over time. Please do not hesitate to contact George F White with details of your property requirements so that we can explore whether any of the units which are currently available may suit your requirements. Or, alternatively, whether there are any other premises located across the Urban Green Newcastle portfolio that might be better suited to your specific needs instead. All of the parks and buildings all have excellent road connections, with the likes of the A167(M), A1058, A186, A193 and B1318 all within close proximity. Whilst, each of the parks can be conveniently accessed from the local public transport network as well. displayAddress: Cragside Business Centre, 2nd Floor, Cragside House, Heaton Road, Newcastle Upon Tyne, NE6 1SE
detailedDescription: DESCRIPTION Cragside Business Centre occupies the second floor of this purpose-built office building. The building has recently been refurbished with a new ground floor foyer. The second floor provides ten serviced office suites with sizes ranging from just 155 sq ft to 1,282 sq ft. Refurbishment to the second floor has included newly painted walls, new carpets and LED lighting. The floor also benefits from a shared meeting room and a shared communal kitchen. Separate WC facilities for the second floor only are available. There is extensive free on-street parking on the surrounding streets. ENERGY PERFORMANCE CERTIFICATE The premises has an EPC rating of D79 BUSINESS RATES Tenants are responsible for paying the business rates in their suite.
